title: EU Financial Crime Compliance Assurance Lead
content:
Since 2011, weâ€™ve had a clear mission: money without borders. Built by and for people who live global lives, weâ€™re the fairest, easiest way to manage your money across borders.Weâ€™re just at the beginning of our story and weâ€™re growing at an incredible pace. We wonâ€™t stop until anyone, anywhere can send, spend and receive money wherever they are, whatever theyâ€™re doing. Thereâ€™s still heaps to do and we canâ€™t do it alone.
Weâ€™re looking for a Monitoring and Testing Lead who will focus on developing and executing our Financial Crime compliance monitoring and testing plan for Europe as our team grows. You will work with colleagues from a wide variety of teams including Product, Treasury, Operations and Compliance to provide assurance and help strengthen Wiseâ€™s approach to managing AML and fraud risks throughout a range of current and new products. You will work with global monitoring and testing colleagues to share best practice and coordinate approaches.
Location: Hybrid working from Tallinn - Estonia ðŸ‡ªðŸ‡ª. Relocation support can be provided.
Your mission:

Work with key stakeholders to develop and deliver a risk based monitoring and testing plan for Europe, including identifying and testing key controls to evaluate compliance with AML rules and regulations.
Proactively communicate solutions to address control gaps or how our processes can be enhanced, as well as tracking these through to completion.
Support the wider monitoring and testing team strategy by collaborating with global colleagues and developing the Europe team.
Adapt your focus depending on the regulatory agenda, growth plans and compliance needs.

A bit about you:

Technical skills. You have a thorough understanding of AML & fraud risks and controls (including KYC, sanctions and transaction monitoring) and have at least 5 years experience designing and carrying out risk-based controls testing in a FinCrime, internal / external audit, or consulting role (experience in a Big-4 firm is a plus).
Industry focus. Ideally you will have a good understanding of NBB expectations and the regulatory landscape around Financial Crime for payment firms in Europe. If you havenâ€™t worked in a compliance role previously, youâ€™re willing to spend time upskilling yourself and embrace the learning curve in the first months of your role.
Management skills. You have experience managing small size teams, providing guidance and feedback to more junior team members.
Languages. Ideally you have good knowledge of either French or Dutch and are fluent in English.
Passion. Youâ€™re excited to work at a fast growing scale-up and youâ€™ve considered the challenges and development opportunities that this brings. Hereâ€™s a taster of what itâ€™s like working at Wise.
Get the job done. Youâ€™re comfortable working with a high degree of autonomy and managing evolving priorities to deliver against the teamâ€™s strategy.
Travel. You will be based in Tallinn but youâ€™ll also work with our colleagues in other locations. Youâ€™ll be ready to travel to meet your objectives, roughly once every two to three months.

What we offer in return:

Competitive base salary
RSUs - Generous stock options package
Hospitalisation and group insurance
Personal development budget
3 'me days'
Volunteering day off
Sports and Wellbeing compensation
Other benefits from our Tallinn's office in here

Interested? Read more:

Our story
https://www.wise.jobs/teams/compliance/
When itâ€™s not just a job: Career development at Wise

We offer some awesome Wise benefits and office perksSalary (monthly)â‚¬3.100â€”â‚¬4.100 EURWe're people without borders â€” without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.

questions.label: What gender identity do you most closely identify with?
I identify my race/ethnicity as (mark all that apply):

answer_options.label: Black or of African or Caribbean descent
